answers.answer: HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!There are a few things you must get tested for: hyperthyroidism, diabetes, Sjogren’s syndrome, anemia and Vit B12 deficiency. Also you could be suffering from an inflammatory bowel condition such as Celiac Disease/Ulcerative Colitis/Irritable Bowel Syndrome/ Crohn’s disease. Parasites in the gut like threadworm, tape worm, giardiasis etc can behave this way. Hence a stool test is a must. Problems of gall bladder and liver or that of pancreas too cannot be ignored.I would strongly recommend you to see a gastroenterologist (a specialist who looks after the diseases of our digestive system). Maybe your physician can recommend someone.Hope this helps. Please let me know if there is any thing else and do keep me posted. Take care!

Some of your blood work is elevated and you should have a more thorough study to determine what the cause is. There are many different things it could be. One is your kidneys may not be functioning properly. Do you ever take in large quantities of protein? Are you a body builder? Are you excessively thirsty? I hope you are having this checked further through a specialist. Ask your family practitioner who to see.

I would probably see an Endocrinologist first because they treat hyperthyroidism and diabetes. Look up Sjogren's and see if any of the symptoms fit you. If it sounds like you then you would go to a rheumatologist. Your family doctor can rule out anemia and B12 deficiency. I would see a gastro doctor after all of the above were addressed. Typically gall bladder, liver, and the pancreas would cause you some kind of discomfort or pain. Do you have anything like that? Do you have problems with diarrhea or constipation?
